net.gotev.uploadservice

Class UploadServiceBroadcastReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • net.gotev.uploadservice.UploadServiceBroadcastReceiver

  • public class UploadServiceBroadcastReceiver
extends BroadcastReceiver
    Broadcast receiver to sublass to create a receiver for UploadService events. It provides the boilerplate code to properly handle broadcast messages coming from the upload service and dispatch them to the proper handler method.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class android.content.BroadcastReceiver

        BroadcastReceiver.PendingResult

      void register(Context context)
      Register this upload receiver.
      If you use this receiver in an Activity, you have to call this method inside Activity.onResume(), after super.onResume();.
      If you use it in a Service, you have to call this method inside Service.onCreate(), after super.onCreate();.
      void unregister(Context context)
      Unregister this upload receiver.
      If you use this receiver in an Activity, you have to call this method inside Activity.onPause(), after super.onPause();.
      If you use it in a Service, you have to call this method inside Service.onDestroy().

    • Method Detail

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive(Context context,
                      Intent intent)
        Specified by:
        onReceive in class BroadcastReceiver

      • register

        public void register(Context context)
        Register this upload receiver.
        If you use this receiver in an Activity, you have to call this method inside Activity.onResume(), after super.onResume();.
        If you use it in a Service, you have to call this method inside Service.onCreate(), after super.onCreate();.
        Parameters:
        context - context in which to register this receiver

      • unregister

        public void unregister(Context context)
        Unregister this upload receiver.
        If you use this receiver in an Activity, you have to call this method inside Activity.onPause(), after super.onPause();.
        If you use it in a Service, you have to call this method inside Service.onDestroy().
        Parameters:
        context - context in which to unregister this receiver

      • onProgress

        public void onProgress(String uploadId,
                       int progress)
        Called when the upload progress changes. Override this method to add your own logic.
        Parameters:
        uploadId - unique ID of the upload request
        progress - value from 0 to 100

      • onProgress

        public void onProgress(String uploadId,
                       long uploadedBytes,
                       long totalBytes)
        Called when the upload progress changes. Override this method to add your own logic.
        Parameters:
        uploadId - unique ID of the upload request
        uploadedBytes - the count of the bytes uploaded so far
        totalBytes - the total expected bytes to upload

      • onError

        public void onError(String uploadId,
                    Exception exception)
        Called when an error happens during the upload. Override this method to add your own logic.
        Parameters:
        uploadId - unique ID of the upload request
        exception - exception that caused the error

      • onCompleted

        public void onCompleted(String uploadId,
                        int serverResponseCode,
                        byte[] serverResponseBody)
        Called when the upload is completed successfully. Override this method to add your own logic.
        Parameters:
        uploadId - unique ID of the upload request
        serverResponseCode - status code returned by the server
        serverResponseBody - byte array containing the response body received from the server. If your server responds with a string, you can get it with new String(serverResponseBody). If the string is a JSON, you can parse it using a library such as org.json (embedded in Android) or google's gson

      • onCancelled

        public void onCancelled(String uploadId)
        Called when the upload is cancelled. Override this method to add your own logic.
        Parameters:
        uploadId - unique ID of the upload request
